image.altText: two lions

props.synopsis: The zoo says the pair, 19-year-old Mujambi and 23-year-old Amani, were euthanased on Thursday morning.

title.children: Adelaide Zoo's only lions euthanased, marking the 'end of an era'

image.altText: Young girl leaning against window

props.synopsis: Essays aren't for everybody, and some students and teachers would like to see more flexible and creative approaches to learning to support those who are neurodivergent.

title.children: Neurodivergent students say 'more creativity in the curriculum' would transform their learning

image.altText: A young woman wearing a white shirt and necklace with trees in the background

props.synopsis: Rebecca Richards's PhD in anthropology is taking her back to the regional community she grew up in to explore photographic archives and preserve Ngarrindjeri stories.

title.children: First Indigenous Rhodes scholar reconnects with her past as she helps to preserve Aboriginal history

image.altText: Albanese meets Li Qiang China

props.synopsis: The prime minister received an assurance from Chinese Premier Li Qiang at a meeting in Laos.

title.children: Chinese trade restrictions on Australian lobsters to be lifted before Chinese New Year

image.altText: He wears a cap and blue shirt and stands near a shipping container

props.synopsis: Veteran truck driver Kym Mozol's vehicle was bogged for almost a week in outback Western Australia. He is now in a "mad panic" as he races against the clock to get to his daughter's wedding in Adelaide.

title.children: Truck driver racing to daughter's wedding after week-long outback bogging ordeal

image.altText: A barbed wire fence with a security camera in the background

props.synopsis: South Australia's Parole Board chairperson says the state's housing crisis is hindering the release of some prisoners and increasing the risk of reoffending.

title.children: Prisoners eligible for release stuck behind bars amid housing crisis

image.altText: Red Capsicums in a box in a greenhouse.

props.synopsis: An army of beneficial bugs is fighting the bad bugs that gnaw on your vegetables, protecting the borders of the largest greenhouse set-up in the southern hemisphere.

title.children: Could 'good bugs' be the secret ingredient to chemical-free vegetables?

image.altText: Craig Goodwin points to the sky

props.synopsis: The Socceroos have come from behind to beat China 3-1 at Adelaide Oval, handing Tony Popovic victory in his first match as coach.

title.children: Craig Goodwin's screamer gives Socceroos victory over China

image.altText: Trump Harris composite

props.synopsis: Professor Allan Lichtman is the "Nostradamus" of US politics. His system has seen him predict the winner of elections consistently since the 1980s and he believes this one is already in the bag.

title.children: Harris or Trump? A political analyst says the race for the White House is already over

image.altText: A street sign for Chinamans Lane

props.synopsis: A South Australian council has voted to keep the controversial name of a rural road in Penola. A descendant of one of the first Chinese people in the area says renaming Chinamans Lane would erase a part of local history.

title.children: Council votes unanimously against changing street's 'offensive' name

image.altText: Two cyclists ride across the desert

props.synopsis: With no support crew or sponsor these two teenagers have spent more than 280 days on the road negotiating floodwaters, bushfires, and running out of supplies as they cross the most remote parts of Australia.

title.children: Teen twitchers raise $100k for Timor-Leste school by cycling around Australia

image.altText: A live sports betting site on a mobile phone, April 24, 2020.

props.synopsis: When the prime minister answered a question about protecting children from gambling harm he gave statistics that mystified experts and advocates. The source of the figures remains a mystery.

title.children: The PM pulled out a mystery statistic when defending a partial ban on gambling ads. It's left experts stumped

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis vial

props.synopsis: The father of a man who took his own life after being prescribed medicinal cannabis says his family was repeatedly sent more cannabis, despite notifying the telehealth platform of his death. The ABC can reveal the founder of the company has been banned from supplying cannabis and two doctors have been suspended.

title.children: A man died after taking medicinal cannabis. His grieving family kept receiving packages from the company

image.altText: A teen girl sitting in front of a pink wall

props.synopsis: Now 13, Hiba dreams of being able to go to school, like other girls her age. Instead she sits on the side of the road, surrounded by bombed and broken houses, selling handmade bracelets.

title.children: Inside the life of a 13 year-old girl, trying to survive 'a war of hell' in Gaza

image.altText: A small group of people in military uniforms look out from a watchtower.

props.synopsis: The allegation came after an Israeli air strike on a school sheltering displaced people in central Gaza killed at least 28 people on Thursday, including women and children, according to medics.

title.children: Israeli forces fire on UN peacekeeper positions in Lebanon, injuring two, UNIFIL says

image.altText: Palm trees sway as a car drives during heavy rain

props.synopsis: Flash flooding warnings and a federal disaster declaration are in place as the dangerous storm makes its way off Florida's east coast.

title.children: 'We have lost some life,' says Florida county sheriff as Hurricane Milton floods state

image.altText: Nadal in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Spain's Rafael Nadal, a 22-time grand slam champion, says it was a difficult decision that took him some time, but "in this life, everything has a beginning and an end".

title.children: Rafael Nadal to retire from professional tennis after next month's Davis Cup

image.altText: Two men walk through a field on a farm with blue sky.

props.synopsis: ACTU president Michele O'Neil is calling on the government to reform a temporary working visa scheme that prevents workers leaving bad bosses and to blacklist dodgy employers who use migration worker exploitation as a business model.

title.children: A temporary working visa scheme slammed as a 'modern day slavery risk' urgently needs overhauling, advocates say

image.altText: A shoe on the floor of a kitchen is seen from up close

props.synopsis: Ecovacs robot vacuums in multiple US cities were hacked in the space of a few days, with the attacker physically controlling them and yelling obscenities through their onboard speakers.

title.children: Robot vacuum yells racial slur at family after being hacked

image.altText: Kyah Simon of Sydney FC posing for the camera, holding a soccer ball in one hand

props.synopsis: A new course to help community coaches, umpires, participants and volunteers deal with incidents of racism in the moment is hoped to improve local sport.

title.children: 'You're fighting on your own': Focus on combating racism in community sport

image.altText: Silhouhette of a woman against a graphic background of red and blue, with a photo of a corridor in the background.

props.synopsis: The workplace safety regulator finds a new centre for women recovering from domestic, sexual and family violence in regional NSW has exposed its workers to "psychological injury", after the departure of most of its frontline staff.

title.children: Staff at Australian-first DV trauma recovery centre raise 'major red flags' over workplace safety

image.altText: Anthony Albanese standing at dispatch box in Parliament.

props.synopsis: Under pressure and reverting to his worst instincts, Anthony Albanese used Tourette syndrome as an insult in parliament. You just had to look at two of his ministers' faces to see how far he'd fouled.

title.children: Eyes darting, mouths open: You just had to look at his ministers' faces to see how far Albanese had fouled

image.altText: Three school students look at phone

props.synopsis: As national leaders grapple with ways to best protect young minds from the potentially harmful effects of social media, students are already talking through some of the issues, and opening up about how taking time out from TikTok and other platforms has helped them live offline.

title.children: Students open up on TikTok detox amid ban talk, as platform reveals it booted a million underage accounts

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu and Joe Biden shake hands in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden and Benjamin Netanyahu have broken nearly two months of silence with a phone call at a tense time in the Middle East — and in their relationship.

title.children: After expletive-ridden extracts released, Biden and Netanyahu talk for the first time in months

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair looks downwards.

props.synopsis: A senior staffer to Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles has alleged she was forced out of her job after raising an internal bullying complaint.

title.children: Deputy PM's top staffer says she was forced out of her job after raising a bullying complaint

image.altText: A middle-aged white woman with a black blazer and glasses sitting in a courtyard

props.synopsis: The national children's commissioner and justice groups have warned against the Northern Territory government's plan to lower the age of criminal responsibility, saying it is "not based on evidence". It comes as the Australian Himan Rights Commission recommends a national approach to youth justice.

title.children: 'Australia is out of step': Calls for national approach to youth justice as NT prepares to lower age

image.altText: Yung Filly smiling on stage holding a microphone.

props.synopsis: British YouTube personality and rapper Yung Filly is granted bail by a Perth court after being accused of sexually assaulting a woman in his hotel room following a show at a Perth nightclub.

title.children: British rapper Yung Filly bailed after being charged with sexually assaulting woman in Perth hotel room

image.altText: A drone and machine parts scattered in a room.

props.synopsis: To fill an urgent labour shortage in wartime Russia, the Kremlin has been recruiting women aged 18-22 from places like Uganda, Rwanda, Kenya, South Sudan, Sierra Leone and Nigeria, as well as the South Asian country of Sri Lanka.

title.children: Africans recruited to work in Russia say they were duped into building drones for use in Ukraine

image.altText: Andrew O'Keefe addresses the media wearing a suit and red glasses

props.synopsis: Andrew O'Keefe entered early guilty pleas to violating and AVO after he went to a Point Piper home in July.

title.children: Former TV host at his 'final crossroads' after sentencing for breaching AVO and meth possession

image.altText: A woman sitting on a bench, speaking and gesturing.

props.synopsis: The princes joins her husband in Southport, north-west England, to meet the families of several children killed in a stabbing attack there earlier this year.

title.children: Princess Catherine makes surprise appearance in English town rocked by deadly stabbing attack

image.altText: A sign reads 'BEAUMARIS PRIMARY SCHOOL' behind gum leaves.

props.synopsis: A survivor of "shocking" sexual abuse at a Melbourne primary school has received what his lawyer has called "the biggest publicly-known payment to an abuse survivor in Australia" in an extraordinary $8 million settlement with the Victorian Education Department.

title.children: Sexual abuse survivor to receive $8 million in record-breaking settlement

image.altText: The two whales are pictured from above in a very turquoise blue ocean

props.synopsis: The federal government is releasing a plan for the management of Australia's south-east marine parks, revealing intentions to expand the areas where new oil and gas projects and fishing are banned.

title.children: Government proposes new oil, gas, fishing bans for Australia's most treasured and 'exploited' oceans

image.altText: Hawthorn Hawks signage at the clubs headquarters in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the club have refuted claims made by its Indigenous former players, calling the allegations "vague and embarrassing".

title.children: Hawthorn Football Club prepares to fight claims of 'racist culture' in Federal Court

image.altText: Aerial photos of new cars, mostly white, lined up a Fremantle Port after unloading in November 2023.

props.synopsis: An aerial photograph of new cars at Fremantle Port tells the story of modern car colours — a sea of white, dotted with some grey/silver and black, with only occasional splashes of red or blue.

title.children: Bright colours banished as white wins out in a monochrome new car market

image.altText: Bunnings store sign

props.synopsis: Bunnings is Australia's most trusted brand. But allegations the hardware chain has been abusing its market power have prompted a Senate inquiry that is set to scrutinise the market power of many large format retailers.

title.children: 'Too big, too powerful?' Main Bunnings competitor lashes out about the hardware chain's dominance
